Actually we did add our own test runner. Four, in fact. Two of them are
simply subclasses of the AWT and Swing test runners that add menus to the
original ones. It would be silly to write an entire test runner from scratch
just for that purpose, although there was some replication of code. Two more
are subclasses of BaseTestRunner, one of which runs on a remote agent and
sends test results back and another runs in a thread and adds results to a
results collector.

By the way and just to clarify, Test Mentor is a stand-alone Java testing
product. Enhanced JUnit is JUnit with some Test Mentor functionality grafted
on via menus, plus the ability to distribute JUnit tests across VMs.

- Mike
